parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Displays a text message in the center of the screen. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "\n" new line characters:<br><tt>[[cutText]] ["line1\nline2\nline3", "PLAIN"];</tt>. Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260 this command supports [[Structured Text]] formatting.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>For greater efficiency and ease of modability it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.57.134673</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cutText''' [text, type, speed,  showInMap, isStructuredText]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> text: [[String]] - text to be displayed

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]] - (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource.

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> showInMap: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> isStructuredText: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to switch support for [[Structured Text]] formatting - see Example 4. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.73.142260</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> layer '''cutText''' [text, type, speed,  showInMap, isStructuredText]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layer: [[Number]] -  layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100.

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> text: [[String]] - text to be displayed

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]] - (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource.

</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> showInMap: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened.

</value></part><part><name>p26</name>=<value> isStructuredText: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to switch support for [[Structured Text]] formatting - see Example 4. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.73.142260</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> layerName '''cutText''' [text, type, speed,  showInMap, isStructuredText] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.57.134673</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p41</name>=<value> layerName: [[String]] - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE

</value></part><part><name>p42</name>=<value> text: [[String]] - text to be displayed

</value></part><part><name>p43</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.

</value></part><part><name>p44</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]] - (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.

</value></part><part><name>p46</name>=<value> showInMap: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value/></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p47</name>=<value> isStructuredText: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to switch support for [[Structured Text]] formatting - see Example 4. <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.73.142260</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value> [[Number]] - number of the allocated layer
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[cutText]] ["", "BLACK OUT"];
[[cutText]] ["Hello World!", "PLAIN", 2];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>2 [[cutText]] ["Hello World!", "PLAIN", 2];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_layer1 = "normal" [[cutText]] ["In The Centre", "PLAIN"];
_layer2 = "down" [[cutText]] ["At The Bottom", "PLAIN DOWN"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value>Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260:<code>[[cutText]] ["&lt;t color='#ff0000' size='5'>RED ALERT!&lt;/t>&lt;br/>***********", "PLAIN", -1, [[true]], [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allCutLayers]], [[titleText]], [[cutRsc]], [[cutObj]], [[cutFadeOut]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on September 20, 2013 - 06:59</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]<dd class="note">In Arma 3 "PLAIN" param will display your text where the crosshair is, "PLAIN DOWN" will push the text further down, closer to the bottom of the screen.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 6, 2016 - 13:32 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Krzmbrzl00|Krzmbrzl00]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The value for '''speed''' has to be greater 0. If 0 is used as speed the default value (1) will be used.<br>
If you want to create an "instant" effect you can use a really small value (e.g. 0.001)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
